intro: Sphaeranthus laciniatus, commonly known as the leafy sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Sphaeranthus laciniatus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils.
